definitions.example: Under some circumstances police are allowed to invade a person's privacy.

definitions.definition: To enter by force in order to conquer.
definitions.example: Argentinian troops invaded the Falkland Islands in 1982.
The picnic was invaded by ants.

definitions.definition: To attack; to infringe; to encroach on; to violate.
definitions.example: The king invaded the rights of the people.

definitions.definition: To make an unwelcome or uninvited visit or appearance, usually with an intent to cause trouble or some other unpleasant situation.
